org.taverna.server.master.interfaces

Interface Policy


  • public interface Policy
    Simple policy interface.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxRuns() 
      Integer getMaxRuns(UsernamePrincipal user)
      Get the limit on the number of runs for this user.
      int getOperatingLimit() 
      List<URI> listPermittedWorkflowURIs(UsernamePrincipal user)
      Get the URIs of the workflows that the given user may execute.
      boolean permitAccess(UsernamePrincipal user, TavernaRun run)
      Return whether the user has access to a particular workflow run.
      void permitCreate(UsernamePrincipal user, Workflow workflow)
      Test whether the user can create an instance of the given workflow.
      void permitDestroy(UsernamePrincipal user, TavernaRun run)
      Test whether the user can destroy a workflow instance run or manipulate its expiry date.
      void permitUpdate(UsernamePrincipal user, TavernaRun run)
      Test whether the user can modify a workflow run (other than for its expiry date).
      void setPermittedWorkflowURIs(UsernamePrincipal user, List<URI> permitted)
      Set the URIs of the workflows that the given user may execute.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxRuns

        int getMaxRuns()
        Returns:
        The maximum number of runs that the system can support.

      • getMaxRuns

        Integer getMaxRuns(UsernamePrincipal user)
        Get the limit on the number of runs for this user.
        Parameters:
        user - Who to get the limit for
        Returns:
        The maximum number of runs for this user, or null if no per-user limit is imposed and only system-wide limits are to be enforced.

      • permitCreate

        void permitCreate(UsernamePrincipal user,
                  Workflow workflow)
           throws NoCreateException
        Test whether the user can create an instance of the given workflow.
        Parameters:
        user - Who wants to do the creation.
        workflow - The workflow they wish to instantiate.
        Throws:
        NoCreateException - If they may not instantiate it.

      • permitDestroy

        void permitDestroy(UsernamePrincipal user,
                   TavernaRun run)
            throws NoDestroyException
        Test whether the user can destroy a workflow instance run or manipulate its expiry date.
        Parameters:
        user - Who wants to do the deletion.
        run - What they want to delete.
        Throws:
        NoDestroyException - If they may not destroy it.

      • permitAccess

        boolean permitAccess(UsernamePrincipal user,
                     TavernaRun run)
        Return whether the user has access to a particular workflow run. Note that this does not throw any exceptions!
        Parameters:
        user - Who wants to read the workflow's state.
        run - What do they want to read from.
        Returns:
        Whether they can read it. Note that this check is always applied before testing whether the workflow can be updated or deleted by the user.

      • permitUpdate

        void permitUpdate(UsernamePrincipal user,
                  TavernaRun run)
           throws NoUpdateException
        Test whether the user can modify a workflow run (other than for its expiry date).
        Parameters:
        user - Who wants to do the modification.
        run - What they want to modify.
        Throws:
        NoUpdateException - If they may not modify it.

      • listPermittedWorkflowURIs

        List<URI> listPermittedWorkflowURIs(UsernamePrincipal user)
        Get the URIs of the workflows that the given user may execute.
        Parameters:
        user - Who are we finding out on behalf of.
        Returns:
        A list of workflow URIs that they may instantiate, or null if any workflow may be submitted.

      • getOperatingLimit

        int getOperatingLimit()
        Returns:
        The maximum number of operating runs that the system can support.

      • setPermittedWorkflowURIs

        void setPermittedWorkflowURIs(UsernamePrincipal user,
                              List<URI> permitted)
        Set the URIs of the workflows that the given user may execute.
        Parameters:
        user - Who are we finding out on behalf of.
        permitted - A list of workflow URIs that they may instantiate.
